post.title: Do you find that no one cares about what you care about?

body:
I’m kind of a unique person so yeah, a lot of time yes. 

For example, I would love to get into fishing again. When I was younger, most of my friends were male but now they’re female so they have no interest in such things, but at least I get to indulge my feminine hobbies with them.

My boyfriends have always kind of been the “pretty boy” types so they didn’t really like my outdoorsy hobbies either. I’m hoping to change that with my next bf.
body_html:
I’m kind of a unique person so yeah, a lot of time yes.

For example, I would love to get into fishing again. When I was younger, most of my friends were male but now they’re female so they have no interest in such things, but at least I get to indulge my feminine hobbies with them.

My boyfriends have always kind of been the “pretty boy” types so they didn’t really like my outdoorsy hobbies either. I’m hoping to change that with my next bf.

post.title: Do you find that no one cares about what you care about?

body:
Yes, but that's partly by design. 

I currently work in the hard sciences, and I tend to gravitate to topics that others aren't currently interested in, because it gives me an opportunity to do something novel and creative in a tiny subfield (as opposed to making an incremental contribution in a big subfield). If I get lucky, I might even get a breakthrough. 

The disadvantage is that my work tends to get ignored, but that only matters for long term career prospects. I expect my scientific career to end when my current contract ends (will probably pick up a trade or something), so I'm going to make the most of the time I have left.

While I see other people making it their god like it's natural and acting like North Korea about my participation in it.

parent.body: The problem with fishing is it's only fun on a good day. But men are constantly raised being told they don't have the right to avoid discomfort, so they endure this and won't let anyone hear it. But we fail to teach perseverance to hardly any women, because our instincts get the best of us, so they usually aren't up for something that's not guaranteed to be 100% enjoyable. Or something that involves any kind of work, and fishing can be frustrating.

post.title: Do you find that no one cares about what you care about?

body: Oh definatley. Look at the mechwarrior guild, theres like 15 of us in there. Know how hard it is to find a playgroup in a small town is? Same with my love of history. Nobody wants to talk about the Lion Hunt of Ashurbanipal. My politics? Im always asked why i care so much. Normies dont seem to understand whats happening. Seemingly nobody wants to be free anymore, and that terrifies me.

Nobody wants to talk about the Lion Hunt of Ashurbanipal. My politics? Im always asked why i care so much. Normies dont seem to understand whats happening. Seemingly nobody wants to be free anymore, and that terrifies me.

post.title: Do you find that no one cares about what you care about?

body: This is the reason that AOL Chat rooms and Yahoo! Answers and IPB Forums were all the rage around the turn of the century, we finally had a way to talk about shit we liked with other people because all too often whatever small town/community you were growing up/living in only had a few people into that thing.

post.title: Do you find that no one cares about what you care about?

body:
Yeah, I care about vaccine passports and the consequences they'll bring, especially to those who refused to take the experimental vaccines. But everyone around me has gotten the shot, and since they wouldn't be adversely affected by the implementation of vax passports (it's the unvaccinated who will), they don't give a crap. 

"Why do u even care? Lmao"
Idk
